CHEF

SUMMARY

Quality-focused and efficient Cook adept at preparing and plating food in high energy, fast-paced kitchens.
Line Cook with 2 years of experience in high-pressure culinary environments.
Skilled in preparing large volumes of food quickly and efficiently.
Seeking to use culinary skills and expertise to prepare a special variety of dishes in a professional, rewarding environment.
Highlights
ServSafe certified Focused and disciplined High volume production capability Well-tuned palette
Focus on portion and cost control Bilingual (English/Spanish)

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Successfully managed a kitchen staff of 7 employees during high volume dinner services for more than 350 diners each night.

EXPERIENCE

<JD_START>
Job Title: Warehouse Receiving Clerk 2nd Shift

Location: Omaha, NE

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Description

 Unique Career Opportunity!

You will work in an exceptionally clean facility with easy and safe-to-use high tech machinery. We are extremely proud that all three of our production plants have received the prestigious Star Safety Award through the OSHA Voluntary Protection Program. This award is highly regarded and sets us apart in the Omaha Area. You will normally have weekends free. You will get advanced training that will help you learn a skilled trade and develop into an expert to help you succeed In this position and prepare you for future growth opportunities at Omaha Steaks. You will have the opportunity to be part of an experienced team. You will work side-by-side with many employees who have been here for 10 years or much longer! 

 Location: Food Production Plant & Warehouse, 9203 F St., South, Omaha, NE 68127 Great Place to Work!

We have created a well-respected, nationwide brand based on our outstanding, wholesome products and our exceptional customer service. That makes for a great customer interaction and something our employees are very proud to be a part of. Despite being the nation's best-known brand of beef and the largest direct marketer of seafood, we're small enough that your contribution can make a real difference. The owners and the management team genuinely care about every employee. So, when it comes to things like employee safety, health care, educational assistance and wellness, we lead the way. 

Essential Job Duties

Responsible for accurately receiving all perishable products from the plants outside vendors and outside storage. Ensures proper count and product specs and notifies appropriate personnel of unusual situations. Counts and verifies weekly physical inventory. Monitors IOH report and rectifies discrepancies with Supervisor. Performs other related duties. Responsible for accurately rotating stock and maintaining the integrity of the product by ensuring it is in the proper temp environment. Helps clean and level pallets for inventory. Other duties as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities

High school diploma or equivalent is preferred. Forklift experience is preferred. Must be able to read, write, and perform basic mathematical calculations. 6 months - Receiving and inventory experience is desirable. Must be able to follow and understand directions accurately Strong attention to detail. Must demonstrate binocular vision.

Schedule Requirements

Full time, 2nd shift, Monday through Friday, 4:00pm-12:30am. Hours are based on business needs. 

Special Note: Military Veterans and their spouses are encouraged to apply.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
